intro: Hieracium wahlenbergii, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium wahlenbergii is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
